data.title: VSCode for Mac OS 10.7.5
data.body:
Is it possible to have VSCode for Mac OS 10.7.5? At the download page it says 10.X but that is definitely wrong.
What are the OS restrictions and why?

data.title: CMD+Left with selection issue
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.8.0-insider (40243d1e01f426f54670f3dbaa6b77d18469310d, 2016-12-09T12:06:36.411Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.1.0


Steps to Reproduce:

1. TS example of code:
```ts
const test = {
    a: 'b',
    c: 'd'
}
```

2. This works ok: put cusror at `3:11` 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/21080044/bdc466d4-bf72-11e6-894f-75c3398f68cd.png)

3. and hit `Cmd+Left`:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/21080046/ca844e52-bf72-11e6-8622-d44ba9fecdb5.png)


4. This does not work: (select text like this)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/21080052/f898494c-bf72-11e6-8a2b-7d91a231ab5b.png)

5. Holding `Shift` hit `Cmd+Left`, here is the result:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/21080058/224d59d0-bf73-11e6-9a4c-cdee8b790c9a.png)

Should be (this is result from Sublime, works the same in Atom):
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/21080060/335fefda-bf73-11e6-98b1-4ad973133cfd.png)


Looks like it might have change recently because I'm pretty sure I was using this combination in the past (but I might be wrong)

data.title: [sql] syntax highlighting misses many keywords

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:
Commit 7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f
Date 2016-11-21T22:14:18.217Z
Shell 1.3.8
Renderer 52.0.2743.82
Node 6.5.0
- OS Version:
Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:

Copy the following text to vscode and set language mode = SQL.
Then cast your eyes down the list for some examples.

-- Control Flow
-- highlighted
IF
BEGIN
END
THROW
TRY
CATCH
-- not highlighted
ELSE
RETURN
WAITFOR
WHILE
GOTO

EXEC          -- highlighted
EXECUTE   -- not highlighted
COLLATE    -- not highlighted

-- DDL
ON DELETE CASCADE
ON UPDATE CASCADE,		--  second CASCADE not highlighted
DEFAULT                                 -- not highlighted
NOT NULL

--	Statements
BEGIN TRANSACTION
BEGIN DISTRIBUTED TRANSACTION    -- DISTRIBUTED not highlighted
SAVE TRANSACTION				  -- SAVE not highlighted			
COMMIT TRANSACTION
COMMIT WORK
ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
ROLLBACK WORK

--	Functions
CONVERT
CAST					--	CAST is blue and CONVERT is yellow?

-- Date and time functions
CURRENT_TIMESTAMP     -- CURRENT_TIMESTAMP is yellow, @@DATEFIRST blue others nothing?
DATEDIFF
@@DATEFIRST
DATENAME
SYSDATETIME

data.title: Selecting highlights merge the next nearby same words
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.2 (7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f, 2016-11-21T22:06:37.428Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.3.9600
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|jshint|dbaeumer|0.10.15|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.2|
|CppSnippets|hars|0.0.5|
|JSDocTagComplete|HookyQR|0.0.2|
|docthis|joelday|0.3.5|
|sublime-keybindings|ms-vscode|1.8.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Input the following text in VS Code:
```
foofoofoofoo
foo
```
2. Now I want to change all the `foo` to `bar`, then I select the second line `foo`
3. Press `Ctrl + F2`, the first line is selected like `foofoo` `foofoo`, not `foo` `foo` `foo` `foo`
4. Input `bar`, the first line become to `barbar`, not `barbarbarbar`
![vs1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8115912/21079036/64e2c504-bfbf-11e6-85fb-de09dc5fe7fa.gif)
The same steps in Sublime Text (except using `Alt + F3` to select highlights)
![st1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8115912/21079049/c062ba10-bfbf-11e6-84c4-b8504b0142dd.gif)

Another example, some text is looking like this:
```
aaaaaaaa
aaaaaa
aa
```
Then I select an `a` at any position, then press `Ctrl + F2` repeatly, the selecting part looks randomly, then input `b`, the length of each line is not the same as before.
![vs2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8115912/21079068/88733412-bfc0-11e6-98a6-2402f295500e.gif)
The same steps in Sublime Text
![st2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8115912/21079073/b3aaf944-bfc0-11e6-928e-611244472883.gif)

data.title: Extension completion item provider is not called after typing character dot in javascript
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2 (7ba55c58, 2016-11-21T22:06:37.428Z)
- OS Version: Windows 7 6.1.7601

Steps to Reproduce:

1. I wrote a javascript variable fields completion provider extension
  (such as,  I write some fields name into a special file. And I can get these fields name after I typing character dot in the javascript file.)
2. Then I got a trouble. Because my provider function `provideCompletionItems` is not called after typing character dot. And It is not called even I type other characters after the dot.
3. But it could be called and return items when I type shortcut `alt+/`(editor.action.triggerSuggest)  
4. Is this a bug, Or I use a wrong way to achieve this function.

Codes:

![code1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4303130/21079054/e3742390-bfbf-11e6-8325-2447a4cd7526.png)

![code2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4303130/21079062/4428f670-bfc0-11e6-9d6e-19b7e3657f88.png)

data.title: JSon LanguageServer completion returns range end before range start
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
```
Version 1.7.2
Commit 7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f
Date 2016-11-21T22:14:18.217Z
Shell 1.3.8
Renderer 52.0.2743.82
Node 6.5.0
```
- OS Version: Fedora 25

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Connect to VSCode-JSon Language server with Eclipse IDE and [LSP4E](https://projects.eclipse.org/projects/technology.lsp4e) . See http://git.eclipse.org/c/gerrit/lsp4e/lsp4e.git/tree/doc/demos/jsonAndSchemaWithVSCode for more instructions
2. Try to get completion for
```js
{
   "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
   "type": "object",
   "title": "JSON schema for component.json files",
    "additionalProperties": true,
   "properties": {
      "key" : {},
      "another": {}
   },
   "minItems": 0,
   "maxItems": "zero",
   "<COMPLETE_HERE>
}

```
3. See response for completion of `additionalItems`
```js
{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":"13","result":{"label":"additionalItems","kind":10,"documentation":"For arrays, only when items is set as an array. If it is a schema, then this schema validates items after the ones specified by the items array. If it is false, then additional items will cause validation to fail.","filterText":"\"additionalItems\"","insertText":"\"additionalItems\": {\n\t{{}}\n}","textEdit":{"range":{"start":{"line":12,"character":0},"end":{"line":11,"character":4}},"newText":"\"additionalItems\": {\n\t{{}}\n}"}}}
```
The bug is Range end comes before range start.

data.title: 2 Issues: Integrated terminal + Running NodeJS
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6

Issue 1:
======
Steps to Reproduce:
1.  View -> integrated terminal
Then I get the the error:
_The terminal process terminated with exit code: 1_

I have tried suggestions mentioned in other tickets but no luck. E.g.:
 1) Re-installing Node and Code
 2) I have added this to "User Settings" 
"terminal.integrated.shellArgs.osx": ["-l"]

All didn't work. 
Note: I can reproduce it in Insiders (1.8.0).

Issue 2:
======
In addition, I have another issue for which I tried several things but the problem is still there. I cannot run my project, it gives me the error:
"Cannot find runtime 'node' on PATH"

Only if I add to launch.json the following line it works:
"runtimeExecutable": "/usr/local/bin/node"
I noticed that my path looks like this:
**PATH=/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin**
But if in Code, toggle developer tools -->show the console and then show "process.env", I see the PATH like this:
**"/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin"**

Which is lacking where node is installed and will fail consequently:
```
which node
/usr/local/bin/node

node -v
v7.2.1
```

I am not sure if there is a single problem causing all these issues in my setup

data.title: Do not change MRU order when navigating while holding down modifier keys
data.body:
When searching for the correct tab (ie. moving through tabs with `cmd+shift+]` and not letting go of `cmd+shift`), VS Code currently switches back to the last tab that it moved over when `ctrl+tab` is pressed.
![](http://g.recordit.co/88l5H2zhI6.gif)

I suggest that VS Code implements the behaviour of making the last used tab equal to that of the "last used tab".  Here is Sublime in action:
![](http://g.recordit.co/bonRoR2Vci.gif)

Sublime will always make the last used tab, that which was active before the key commands were held down for moving between tabs.

I understand that you could click on the tab with your mouse, find it in the quick search or use other keyboard commands, but I work with a lot more tabs than the contrived gifs suggest and I believe that Sublime has the correct behaviour.  It would be good to see this in VS Code.

data.title: Custom keybindings are applied to wrong cursor when findInputFocussed

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:  1.7.2 (7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f)
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04.5 LTS

keybindings.json
`[`
`{ "key": "ctrl-a",       "command": "expandLineSelection", "when": "findInputFocussed"},`
`{ "key": "ctrl-h",       "command": "deleteWordLeft"}`
`]`

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open find widget ie `alt-e f`
2. typing ctrl-a will expand the selection around the invisible cursor in the editor body
3. typing ctrl-h will delete words in the editor body

The when clause is being successfully applied in the first case but the commands are happening at the wrong cursor ie typing `ctrl-a` will not select all, instead it will expand the selection around the invisible cursor in the editor body.

Globally applied keybindings do the same thing ie the second entry in keybindings.json

This occurs with **every** custom keybinding I've tested.

PS. I discovered `findInputFocussed` when browsing the properties of the copy/pasted context in [#16498](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/16498).. it's misspelled and the correct spelling doesn't work. Not the core of my problem but maybe worth noting.

I'm new to VS Code and I love it so far! Thank you and keep up the great work!

data.title: Autocomplete triggered on backspace
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Type `foo` + a space.
2. Backspace once.
3. Autocomplete dropdown is shown.

To me, this makes no sense and is disruptive. Autocompletion should only occur for the word I'm typing. If I typed a word and then space, then I was finished with it. The autocompletion dropdown is visually disruptive, but is also disruptive of one's typing. For example, if the steps are:

1. Type `foo` + a space.
2. Backspace once.
3. Press Enter.

...then no line break is inserted, because the Enter keypress confirmed the autocomplete box. I wouldn't expect this to happen: It means whether or not Enter has an effect is not deterministic; I would expect hitting Backspace + Enter in _any_ part of the editor to result in delete + line break, but this isn't true. I constantly find myself fighting the autocomplete dropdown because of this.

data.title: LanguageServer Crash after successuflly executing onDidChangeContent callback
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0 - Insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

Hello,

I am trying to integrate an xml linter in vscode and have a problem, that after my ondidchangecontent, after I ran xmllint and  the callback returned successfully (message in the last line of my event callback) my language server crashes and gets restarted.

I read it might have to do with memory leaks that node crashes there, but I am not able to obtain any debug information and the language server is not putting out any logs (or they are hidden anywhere).

Steps to Reproduce:

1. clone this repo: https://github.com/apazureck/vscode-xml-linter.git
2. open server folder
3. run "npm install"
4. run Build task
5. open client folder
6. run "npm install"
7. start client project
8. open in the extension development host the folder test (included in the repo)
9. open the test.xml document
10. do some changes on the document (spaces anywhere)

-> After that have a look on the console. The Languageserver will crash after the onDidDocumentChange ran.

So my questions are:
1. Why is this happening? Am I doing something wrong or may this be a bug somewhere else?
2. How can I get the crash dump from my language server? I looked everywhere and tried to catch uncaught exceptions on the server.

Thank you

data.title: "Go To Symbol in Workspace" command provides inconvenient UX in some cases.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.2 (7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f, 2016-11-21T22:06:37.428Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.3.9600
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-file-peek|abierbaum|1.0.1|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.0.18|
|project-manager|alefragnani|0.12.2|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.1.0|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.2|
|vscode-generate-getter-setter|DSKWRK|0.4.1|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.3.4|
|tslint|eg2|0.7.1|
|RelativePath|jakob101|0.11.0|
|docthis|joelday|0.3.5|
|Angular2|johnpapa|1.0.2|
|refactorix|krizzdewizz|0.3.0|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.3.2|
|typescript-hero|rbbit|0.11.0|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|4.0.5|
|vscode-terminal-here|Tyriar|0.0.5|
|gitblame|waderyan|1.3.0|

---

"Go To Symbol in Workspace" command (CTRL+T) is one of the most useful commands used for navigation in workspace, but in some cases it can be not so useful as it could be. Here is a couple of examples (usually I use VS code for typescript projects):

1. When I run vs code and there are no opened files, CTRL+T doesn't provide any result. For new users of VS code it's a bit unobvious fact, that you should open some file before perform some navigation.
2. If I have several tsconfig.json files in my workspace (atleast two), it performs search only within nearest one relative to an editing file. So, I can't see any classes and interfaces from the first project if I'm editing a file from the second project.

I suppose that this a bit strange behaviour origins from Typescript Language Service (tsserver), but can these issues be resolved on VS Code side? Most of users expect that "Go To Symbol in Workspace" performs search through whole workspace folder and through all projects in this workspace.

Thanks for awesome editor, it's really great!

data.title: Where do we help with translations?
data.body:
I had forked this repo to improve the german translation, but then I saw that the translation files themselves are auto generated and are not to be edited manually. (at least per the warning at the top)

Where do we aid in translating the project properly? The german translation feels machine generated to me and I'd like to help with that (native speaker myself).

data.title: Duplicate of #16338: Add context actions along the lines of IntelliJ
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 

Version 1.8.0-insider
Commit 40243d1e01f426f54670f3dbaa6b77d18469310d
Date 2016-12-09T12:05:39.439Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0

- OS Version:
Ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. New feature request

Currently VSCode has no way to provide context actions that allow extension developers to provide quick fixes for issues that can be resolved. For eg., I have implemented an interface that expects 3 methods to be implemented.

Tho the compiler shows error & vscode displays these errors, but that's where the story currently ends.

If the platform is to be more user friendly => it should be extension friendly => it should have reasonable extension points to hook into => the need for this feature.

Thanks for all your hard work in making vscode one of most promising opensource editors of our time.

For more info:
https://www.jetbrains.com/help/resharper/2016.1/Coding_Assistance__Context_Actions.html

data.title: While Publishing Project in Visual Studio Code MarketPlace
data.body:
Hi,

I have written one ASP.NET Core-Angular 2 starter kit. This project I wanted to publish. But, while doing so, I am getting timeout error saying "Error: Request timeout: /_apis/gallery/extensions"

- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Download the code from https://github.com/rahulsahay19/MovieReviewStarterKit 
2. Download Package.json from https://gist.github.com/rahulsahay19/5a21c2e0dd23fd20d63698cde407d1ac
3. I have kept this under MovieReviewStarterKit folder as well.
4. Then, applied vsce publish command. 
5. Publish started, then after waited for sometime, it gave timeout error. 

My question is whether we can publish any project as extension. If yes, am I doing something wrong here. Looks like Package.json is not compliant with project system. 

Thanks,
Rahul

data.title: Feature Request: Git Diff/Undo from gutter

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hello

vscode 1.7.2

VSCode displays changed lines in the gutter. However to 'undo' a change, we have to first stage all the changes we want, and then undo whatever is left.

However this requires many clicks and context changes.
1. Git  
2. Diff   
3. Click Lines you want to keep  
4. Click undo on non-stages lines   

In Visual Studio I have an extension that allows me to undo lines/hunks by clicking that git gutter decoration:

![diff margin example](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5593825/21073237/066e5ccc-bed9-11e6-867f-22029b887a93.gif)

I do not think it is possible to create a similar extension because there is no public api to hook the click event. So I am requesting it either be integrated into VS, or expose click events as an API.

data.title: When Auto Save enabled Run Build Task should trigger save before building
data.body:
When I execute Run Build Task I would expect the latest **saved** version of my code to be compiled. When auto save feature is enabled as a user I assume that the code is always saved so I would expect the **current** version of the code to be always compiled. Very often I Run Build Task immediately after i make this change and it's not always yet saved at this point by the Auto Save timer.
Auto-save on compile would be the short name.

data.title: No color javascript after `${+new Date}`
